The Trump-Pence administration is trying to strip the #HealthCareRights Law - a law under the ACA that protects patients against sex discrimination - turning back the clock on our rights. #PutPatientsFirst
Democrats followed through on our commitment to make health care and prescription drugs more affordable and accessible #ForThePeople by passing legislation that will #ProtectOurCare.

We need to act to address health disparities in maternal care. Black mothers are nearly 4x more likely to die from complications that white mothers. That's why @SenKamalaHarris and I reintroduced the #MaternalCAREAct to combat implicit bias in healthcare. #TrustBlackWomen
I reintroduced the #MaternalCAREAct to improve Black maternal health outcomes, and included a program that would provide for PMH programs in 10 additional states!
After implementation, the pregnancy-related mortality rate for Black women in North Carolina dropped from 51.1 to 24.3 per 100,000 live births.
North Carolina has the only statewide pregnancy medical home (PMH) program in the nation & it works!

Proud to stand with @SenKamalaHarris and reintroduce the #MaternalCAREAct to improve maternal health outcomes for Black mothers by implementing implicit bias training and at home care. #BlackMamasMatter

Mothers are breadwinners in half of U.S. families with minor children, yet moms with full-time, year-round jobs are paid 71 cents for every dollar paid to fathers. #WhatMomsNeed is the #PaycheckFairness Act.

In Democrats’ fight #ForThePeople, we have sent legislation to the Senate that supports paycheck fairness, climate action, & more. We have heard the American people. Now, it’s time for @SenateMajLdr McConnell to stop ignoring their call for progress!

Ahead of #MothersDay, I’m so grateful to @RepLawrence, @RepRobinKelly, @RepBarbaraLee & @JacksonLeeTX18 for joining me tonight to raise awareness about our country’s Black maternal health crisis & ways we can improve outcomes for Black mothers! #BlackMamasMatter

My colleagues and I spoke out tonight to call attention to Black maternal health outcomes. We will continue to work with advocates like @BlkMamasMatter @mom_congress @everymomcounts @amprog to solve this public health crisis!
